Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER RIVERA.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, N.Y. 10007.

Council Member _____ moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 12, 2001, be adopted and printed by Council Member Lopez.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Lopez moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 12, 2001 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title:
Communication from the Board of Elections in the City of New York - Submitting the Certification of Election of Andrew J. Lanza, as the new Council Member of the 51st Councilmanic District, Richmond County.

THE CITY CLERK AND CLERK OF THE COUNCIL PERFORMS THE FORMAL CEREMONY OF THE DULY ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBERS DIANA REYNA AND ANDREW J. LANZA TAKING THEIR OATH OF OFFICE

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Eisland
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter and Section 62-722(a) of the Zoning Resolution, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 010616 ZSK, a special permit, and application no. N 010617 ZAK, an authorization, shall be subject to Council review. These applications are related to applications no. C 010615 ZMK and C 010619 HAK which are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Zoning Resolution, Special Permit (C010616ZSK)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Eisland
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 010677 HDM, a disposition, and no. C 010678 ZSM, a special permit, shall be subject to Council review. These applications are related to applications no. C 010675 HUM and C 010676 ZMM which are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, City-owned non-residential real property, Manhattan (010677HDM)

Items.Title:
By Council Members Michels and Perkins:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 000507 PPM, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Disposition of Properties CB#10 CD#7, Manhattan (C000507PPM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Miller:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 1140 Second Avenue, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20015418 TCM.)
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 1140 Second Ave, Manhattan  (20015418TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Members Spigner and Povman:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20010620, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Disposition of properties CD#42, Brooklyn (C010070PPK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Wooten:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20010070, shall be subject to Council review.

Items.Title: Resolution condemning in the strongest manner possible the anti-Semitism expressed in the Egyptian newspapers Al-Akhbar and Al-Gomhuriya and asserting that such conduct is part of the problem in creating a climate where terrorism can exist and flourish.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Condemning the anti-Semitism expressed in Egyptian newspapers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to pass S. 1225 and H.R. 1021 placing an abridged version of the Constitution on the back of United States currency.
Items.MatterName: Placing an abridged version of the Constitution on the back of US Currency (S.1225, H.R. 1021)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct oversight hearings on the safety of the City's public transportation system.
Items.MatterName: Hold hearings on the safety of the City's public transportation system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature and the Governor to support S. 4373, an Act authorizing the City to reinstate the modest charge to non-residents who work in the City for their use of City services, also known as the "commuter tax", the elimination of which is costing the City of New York half a billion dollars a year during a time when the City is facing serious financial difficulties as a result of the September 11th terrorist attacks, and must do even more, in the wake of the attacks, to protect those who work and live in the City.
Items.MatterName: Reinstate the "commuter tax" (S.4373)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter in relation to the effective date of amendments concerning the board of health.
Items.MatterName: Effective date of amendments concerning the board of health.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting House Concurrent Resolution 249 calling upon the 107th Congress to hold a joint session in New York City in the wake of the September 11th Terrorist Attacks on the World Trade Center.
Items.MatterName: Congress joint session in NYC in the wake of 9/11 Terrorist Attacks

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Mr. Green) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
The Public Advocate (Mr. Green) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Eisland
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 010677 HDM, a disposition, and no. C 010678 ZSM, a special permit, shall be subject to Council review. These applications are related to applications no. C 010675 HUM and C 010676 ZMM which are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, City-owned non-residential real property, Manhattan (010677HDM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Eisland
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter and Section 62-722(a) of the Zoning Resolution, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 010616 ZSK, a special permit, and application no. N 010617 ZAK, an authorization, shall be subject to Council review. These applications are related to applications no. C 010615 ZMK and C 010619 HAK which are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Zoning Resolution, Special Permit (C010616ZSK)
